snippets.snippet: Japanese Buddhist cuisine - shojin ryori - offers up elegant and flavorful food. Sesame tofu with wasabi, vegetable tempura, handmade buckwheat noodles, more. ... Osaka, and Nagoya, where the vibrant colors and healthy dishes make shojin ryori especially popular among health-conscious young women.

snippets.snippet: Indians in Japan speak a number of different languages and follow various religions; there is little correlation between religion or language and profession, except in the case of the Jains, many of whom work in the jewellery industry. The Jains are generally concentrated around Okachi-machi in Taitō, Tokyo.

snippets.snippet: Dewa Sanzan Shōjin Ryōri – Local Cuisine Developed by Mountain Priests. Shōjin Ryōri dishes differ from temple to temple and from region to region as the ingredients used very much reflect what vegetables can be found in the mountains and forests nearby.
snippets.title: Dewa Sanzan Shōjin Ryōri - Tsuruoka, Yamagata - Japan Travel
